The plant features a rosette of sword-shaped, evergreen leaves that can grow up to 3 feet in length. Its flowers, which can be red, orange, or yellow, bloom in clusters and are often followed by the development of small, edible berries. Vriesea hillegeeriana is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental value and relatively low maintenance requirements.
